channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Potholes in road as you come down the hill, 24th February
item.description:
A series of medium sized potholes on the left hand side as you descend the hill. require avoidance meaning cars cross centre line of road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harp Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large deep pothole in road - increasing in size, 24th February
item.description:
On Porchester Road - hundred yards from electricity substation on junction with Millbridge Road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Porchester Road, Gloucester

item.title: Several potholes that are very deep and caused damage to car, there are several so cannot avoid, 24th February

item.title: Full degraded road surface Roberts Road, 24th February
item.description:
This road needs investigating in full. The full road surface has degraded on roberts road and is no longer safe.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Roberts Road, Noverton, Cheltenham

item.title: Storms have cause two branches to have been torn from a tree. Tree needs pollarding to shorten other branches and tidy damage., 24th February
item.description:
On grass verge outside number 37 Moselle Drive.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Moselle Drive, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Appalling pothole - reopened, 24th February
item.description:
Appalling pothole - reopened on the busy Prestbury High St. It may even be deeper than a tennis ball. Repaired recently and is now open again. Is it correct that the maintenance firm who repairs the potholes has just been given a new 5 year deal? Their repairs seem to be very poor quality and always reopening.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, High Street, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes and disintegrating road surface, 24th February
item.description:
This part of the awful North Road West was only 'repaired' a few weeks ago and the state of this part of the road is even worse now,after a so called repair. Its dreadful.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, North Road West, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic diversion sign lying on pavement, 24th February
item.description:
Apologies if you have already received this, apologies too as none of the subcategories was appropriate. There is a sign lying on the pavement outside 40 Kingscroft Road, in the way of pedestrians and possibly a safety hazard. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingscroft Road, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign structurally damaged/leaning more than 20 degrees/loose in ground (Non illuminating sign)

item.title: Missing signs on Public Right of Way footpath in The Leigh, 24th February
item.description:
No signs on Public Right of Way Footpath ALH26 Footpath next to Banna Tra house at top of Blacksmiths Lane, running through Denes Hollow on Deenes Road. Both signs each end of footpath removed. This has been reported several times and no action taken. New signs needed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blacksmith Lane, Leigh, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain completely blocked with mud/silt, with cigarette box balanced on top., 24th February
item.description:
The drain next to the little footbridge which leads from Farmfield Rd to Japonica Drive. Large willow tree adjacent. Farmfield Rd's drains are prone to flooding the street if they are not kept clear.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 166, Farmfield Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
